definition: investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Di4 zhi4 Diao4 cha2 ju2
Mei3 guo2 Di4 zhi4 Diao4 cha2 ju2

sentences.english: The RCMP said its investigation is continuing.
sentences.chinese: 皇家騎警稱調查正在繼續。

sentences.english: That's according to a new AP Ipsos poll.
sentences.chinese: 這是根據最新的美聯社依普索民意調查得出的結論。

sentences.english: More than 2,000 women aged 18-34 were  interviewed for the poll.
sentences.chinese: 共有兩千多名18歲至34歲的女性參與了該項調查。

sentences.english: The work is published in the European Journal of Operational Research.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究調查刊登在歐洲運籌學雜誌上。

sentences.english: The patterns identified do still apply, but perhaps to a lesser extent.
sentences.chinese: 我們調查的模式仍然適用，但是使用範圍要小一些。

sentences.english: Comparisons with our previous studies on the Yami children were included in the present report.
sentences.chinese: 本報告中亦包括與蘭嶼學童調查結果之比較。

sentences.english: During 2 years observation and came to the conclusion that the best training method was branch bending method.
sentences.chinese: 經兩年調查結果，三種方法中以屈株法效果最佳。

sentences.english: Gibson has interviewed people to understand how they  conceptualize teams.
sentences.chinese: 吉布森調查了人們對於“團隊合作”這一概念的認識。

sentences.english: Perak, Malaysia is currently the police are stepping into the cause.
sentences.chinese: 目前馬來西亞霹靂州警方正在加緊調查事故的原因。

sentences.english: Did their parents check up on their whereabouts and set curfews?
sentences.chinese: 他們的父母會調查他們的行蹤並實施宵禁嗎？

sentences.english: The shovel is the one tool that Davis and his fellow principal investigators do not use.
sentences.chinese: 鏟子是戴維斯和他的主要調查者棄之不用的工具。

sentences.english: But the prosecutor declined on the grounds that the issue should be investigated in the US.
sentences.chinese: 但檢察官拒絕的理由是，這個案子應當在美國調查。

sentences.english: But only 16 percent of workers in France said they had done so.
sentences.chinese: 但是這樣的情況在受調查的法國員工中卻只有16%。

sentences.english: But he is also under the gun from lawmakers over Bank Century.
sentences.chinese: 但是他也處於世紀銀行調查的槍口之下。

sentences.english: The government will look into the working conditions of the workers.
sentences.chinese: 政府將對工人們的工作條件進行調查研究。

sentences.english: An international investigation said a North Korean torpedo sank the ship.
sentences.chinese: 一項國際調查顯示朝鮮的魚雷炸沉了天安艦。

definition: to inform/to report/to make known/report/speech/talk/lecture/CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]
to have sth to do with/to relate to/related to/to concern/concerning
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy
to target/to focus on/to be aimed at or against/in response to
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
